section.name: About Housekeeper
section.p: This project's goal is to provide an application for managing household issues. Currently, it is able to keep a list of food inlcuding their expiry dates so you always have an overview of what is going to seed soon.
Please see the Requested features tracker for planned features. If you have an idea for an additional feature please don't hesitate to create a new entry to the tracker!

section.name: Prerequisites
section.p: Housekeeper is compatible with every computer for which a Java Runtime Environment (JRE) is available. This includes computers running on Windows 95/98/ME/2000/XP, Macintosh OS X, Linux or Solaris. Housekeeper runs with any JRE of version 1.4 or greater.
You can download a JRE for free here. Please follow the installation instructions for the "J2SE Runtime Environment (JRE)"
If your operating system is Macintosh OS X or Linux you probably already have a JRE installed. Make sure your JRE's version is at least 1.4

ol.li: Download Housekeeper here! Pick the .zip file for Windows or the .tar.gz file for any other platform.

Decompress the ZIP or GZ archive to the location you want Housekeeper to be installed.
If you are upgrading from an older version of Housekeeper please make sure to remove that version completely by deleting the folder before copying the new version to the same location. Your household data will not be deleted by this action because it is saved in the user's home directory, not in the application's directory.
Start Housekeeper by double-clicking on housekeeper-0.2.2.jar.
If that doesn't work start Housekeeper by double-clicking on housekeeper.bat when running on Windows or use housekeeper.sh on any other platform.
